fields.summary: Add parameters to the url entry in AccessLogFilters

fields.description:
Without changing any other things in our setup, after Updating Confluence from 2.7 to 3.0.1 the custer savety manager stops the application with "cluster panic" neary every night at database backup time (7:50am).

* It never stops at other times (, it's no "other running instance" problem or something like this).
* This never happens during database backups with Confluence before 3.x

I've attached a log with ClusterSavetyManager's loglevel set at DEBUG. Because it's a company-internal wiki, Confluence is totally idle at backup time. You'll see the successful checks just before the db backup, the shutdown and the successful checks afterward.

Notice, that the check @195030.054 (Worker-3) seems to be stuck in waiting for the database and the scheduled check @ 195100.026 (Worker-9) is "passing by". In the other hand, Worker-3 finishes the check successful afterwards.

From this i would derive, that no database connection timeout have happended but just a short "freeze" caused by the database dump operations.

IMHO there should just one check running at a time. Did some kind of locking become unfunctional?
fields.summary: Unclustered instance stopps with cluster panic during db backup since Confluence V3

fields.description:
From Confluence 3.1 onwards, a customer will require a version 2 license in order for Confluence to operate. This means: 

# all upgrades to 3.1 will require a version 2 license
# all new installs of 3.1 will require a version 2 license

In the event that an upgrade is performed using an old license, we will provide a customer a link to http://my.atlassian.com where their license can be upgraded to version 2. If for whatever reason this fails, provide a link to generate a temporary eval license to tide the customers over until they have resolved any license upgrade issues.
fields.summary: Require version 2 licensing for Confluence 3.1

fields.description:
We upgraded from Confluence 3.0.1 to 3.0.2 during the weekend. I now see that the move functionality is broken. When I try to move a page (an existing one, a move of a newly created page works fine) the edit screen opens and I can't move, see screenshot. Does anybody else have this behaviour?

I tried to move existing page "BlaBla" -> Screenshot "existing_page_move_broken.png"
Deleted this page, created new one with same name "BlaBla" -> Screenshot "new_page_move_working.png"

Reproducable for anybody?
fields.summary: Move broken in Confluence 3.0.2?

Add page restrictions to a page.

Reload the page. While the page is still loading, click on the padlock icon. Instead of opening the new permissions dialog, you will be redirected to the Info page.  This is unexpected behaviour, and could cause confusion.

The text "confluence.macros.advanced.content-by-user.param..desc" appears under the username field. There is no entry for this key in macro-fallback.properties so there should be no text at all.

This affects all macros in the macro browser in 3.1.

fields.description:
Exception suggests the upgrade failed because the column already exists.

Given that the table has been there for a number of version - or at least seems to be based on the data in the table, and the column being added is the primary key for this table, I find the exception, and what appears to be the inability to handle the concept of needing to "creating something that already exists" a little more gracefully perplexing.

The good news is that reverting back to 2.10.4 went without a hitch.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17177].
  {panel}

I'm filing this improvement request on behalf of an evaluator. 

• would it be possible to either remove the Team Label description (see screenshot), or make it an optional parameter? 

It would be cleaner and less space consuming.

(see original email in private comment)

fields.description:
If an LDAP user does not have a valid email address they are not able to update their user profile.  See screenshots.

1 - adding a phone number
2 - after clicking save, error about invalid email
3 - shows the phone number did not save

The workaround would be to edit the LDAP entries so that user emails are actually valid emails.  However, it might be worth it to tell Confluence to ignore the email validator in the case of LDAP user profiles.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17172].
  {panel}

Hello,

a common use case would be to define numbered headings within separate pages collected in a single "master document" using the \{include\} macro. Currently no numbered heading will be generated (that is already tracked on CONF-1732) but still, the numbering in the resulting list will be reset at every included page. If context could be passed to the included page the numbered list renderer could continue with the global enumeration rather that resetting to 1, resulting in documents with the structure  
{noformat}
1.
   a.
   b.
1.
   a.
   b.
{noformat}

Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: Numbered lists to be context aware to support the _include_ macro tag

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolved in Confluence 3.5|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
We are pleased to advise that support for nested groups is available in Confluence 3.5. You can find instructions on how to configure nested groups in our documentation:

* [Configuring User Directories|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+User+Directories]

More information about the great new features available with the release of Confluence 3.5 can be found in [the release notes|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+3.5+Release+Notes]. Thanks for your interest and support of Confluence.
{panel}


Currently in Atlassian-user, groups can only include users, not other groups. Support for nested groups would allow groups to contain other groups.

For example, consider the following simplified LDAP records:

dn: cn=sales,ou=groups
cn: sales
member: cn=salesman,ou=users

dn: cn=staff,ou=groups
cn: staff
member: cn=ceo,ou=users
member: cn=sales,ou=groups

In this example, the group 'sales' is a group containing just a single user, 'salesman'. However, the 'staff' group contains both the user 'ceo' and the group 'sales'. 

In Atlassian-user, implementing nested groups would mean that 'salesman' would be a member of both 'sales' and 'staff' in the above scenario. Atlassian-user should also recognise that both users and groups can be members of a group, especially when listing the membership information for a group. (That is, a list of the members of 'staff' should have two entries: an entry for the 'ceo' user and an entry for the 'sales' group. The membership should not automatically be condensed into a list of two users.)

In applications, permissions granted to the 'staff' group should apply to both 'salesman' and 'ceo'. Additionally, any new users added to 'sales' should automatically gain these permissions.
fields.summary: Support nested groups

fields.description:
Searching for strings with german umlauts are no problem without wildcard.
F.e. the word "Mikrohärtemessung" with the umlaut character "ä":
"Mikrohärtemessung" finds Mikrohärtemessung (OK).
"Mikrohartemessung" is finding Mikrohärtemessung (Good).
"Mikroh*" is finding all: Mikrohärte, Mikrohärtemessung, Mikrohärteprüfung, etc. (OK).
"Mikroharte*" is finding all: Mikrohärte, Mikrohärtemessung, Mikrohärteprüfung, etc. (OK).

BUT:
"Mikrohä*" (containing the umlaut) finds nothing, zero. 
=======================================

fields.description:
The implementation of ClusterManager for non clustered licenses does not implement any kind of locking at all.

This means oncePerCluster (such as the ClusterSafetyJob) jobs can run concurrently, amongst other problems, which can lead to errors. 

Update: see the comment below for patch instructions.
fields.summary: NonClusterManager does not prevent concurrent execution of jobs

fields.description:
The instructions embedded in the file are:
{code}
        <!-- CROWD respository -->
        <!--
             You will need to uncomment the repository below to enable Crowd integration. For more information,
             please see:

             You must also uncomment the osuser repository above.

             http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/3.2.3+Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+Confluence
        -->
        <!--
        <crowd key="crowd" name="Crowd Repository"/>
        -->
        <!-- END of CROWD repository -->
{code}
What they should say is something along the lines of:
{code}
        <!-- Crowd Integration.
          
          Edit this file so its contents are:
 
          <atlassian-user>
              <repositories>
                  <crowd key="crowd" name="Crowd Repository"/>
              </repositories>
          </atlassian-user>

          Full instructions at: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+Confluence
        -->
{code}
fields.summary: Instructions in atlassian-user.xml for Crowd integration are incorrect
Use friendly date format for page metadata

fields.description:
TinyMCE has a flag called [cleanup|http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Configuration/cleanup].  The documentation says:
bq.  Notice: It's not recommended to disable this feature. 

Confluence has always disabled this feature, and in early days may have needed to, since it requires various extra parameters to help with the conversion back to wiki markup.

However, TinyMCE also currently provides [valid_elements|http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Configuration/valid_elements] and [extended_valid_elements|http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Configuration/extended_valid_elements] settings to allow extra parameters to be specified.

We should set the valid_elements appropriately and then turn both cleanup and probably [cleanup_on_startup|http://wiki.moxiecode.com/index.php/TinyMCE:Configuration/cleanup_on_startup] on.  This would probably solve some of the issues have with the RTE.  It could quite possibly cause a few problems too, so it will need very thorough testing.
fields.summary: Turn on TinyMCE's cleanup flag
Better error should be given when the Plugin Repository cannot be loaded

fields.description:
I have a filter that returns a list of issues and I have created a portlet with this filter that displays the issue's Extended Summary (among other fields).
I display it in Confluence using the jiraportlet macro.

The rendering is OK with Mozilla Firefox but with IE nothing (almost) is returned (see screenshot: below "Real release backlog" I should get a list of issues instead of the four lines shown). 

After having imagined different possibilities, I have found out that the problem came from the Summary of one of the issues returned by the filter: it had the characters {color:red}<{color}  and {color:red} >{color} which produced a parsing error in the browser.
Once these characters were removed from the Summary, the jiraportlet was correctly displayed in IE.

I have been looking for a list of forbidden characters to be used in Jira issue's summary but have found none.


Is this a limitation of the jiraportlet macro when using IE?
Can you provide another solution than removing the characters from the Summary?

Thanks in advance
fields.summary: jiraportlet macro not displayed in IE (7) if characters < > appear in issue's summary
Consecutive Italic lines break in RTE round-trip
Update translations overview page, and request Spanish and Portuguese on top of all other translations

fields.description:

#PutApplName#_#PUTDATE#_#CID#_#TIMESTAMP#_#COUNT#.txt (created in TinyMCE) 
--> save --> 
[PutApplName]\#_\#PUTDATE#_\#CID#_\#TIMESTAMP#_\#COUNT#.txt (result after saving in wiki markup)
{code}

This will destroy the entered string - maybe escaping every _ and # automaticaly within TinyMCE will help?

This happens also here in jira ! Only the \{code\} tag will help.

fields.description:
*License Expiration*
Customers who choose not to renew their maintenance should still be allowed to upgrade or reinstall versions that were released up to the date of the expired license. For example, if a license expired in March of 2008, the customer should be able to apply their expired licnese up to version 2.7.3 (or now, given our change, 2.7.4). The newly released versions in accordance with the [license change|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Coherence+license+changes+SEPT+2009+-+new+Standard+and+Clustered+Confluence+Editions] behave as if they are new distributions, meaning that an expired license is not accepted.

While this only affects expired licensees (and therefore do not qualify for support), is it in fact a break from how it was working. We should back-date the new distributions of the old versions.

*Steps to replicate*
# Download one of the older versions - I used 2.7.4
# Try to install, using an expired license (see note below for a copy of an expired license)

Screenshot is attached.

As a contrast, 2.7.3 _does_ accept the old license.
fields.summary: New distributions without tangosol jars do not respect expired license policy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17106].
  {panel}

Now the all spaces tab shows only accessible spaces. So a user doesn't see which other spaces exist also.

So he might never get an idea to ask someone to get involved into a space.

An idea is now to add an accessible tab which shows all the "*Accessible*" spaces and *rework the all tab*, to show all spaces *with their space admins*.

If a user wants access to a space he is now able to send an email to the space admins to get access to that particular space.

I got the idea while using the [CSUM-Plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Custom+Space+User+Management+Plugin] and was looking at this [issue|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-5302]

regards Christian
fields.summary: Rework spaces tabs on dashboard and add an really all spaces tab

fields.description:
Using the SDK I am tryin to wire up ExportDownloadResourceManager through constructor injection.
The class activation is failing because of 
{code}
org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: 
Error creating bean with name 'XXXX': 
Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 2 of type [com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.resource.ExportDownloadResourceManager]: : 
No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.resource.ExportDownloadResourceManager] is defined: 
Unsatisfied dependency of type [class com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.resource.ExportDownloadResourceManager]: 
expected at least 1 matching bean;
{code}

I have solved the problem by wiring the property "manualy" using 
{code}
ContainerManager.getComponent("exportDownloadResourceManager")
{code}
but this is hardly ideal.

There is a forum post about this issue at [http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=37519&tstart=0]

and there is documentation suggesting that my initial approach would be effective at
[http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=107185152]
Thisis actually a code sample that would expose the problem: exportDownloadResourceManager is not automatically injected in the setter.
fields.summary: ExportDownloadResourceManager can't be autowired in atlassian-plugin-sdk-3.0-beta5

fields.description:
We upgraded one Confluence yesterday from 2.6 to 3.0.1. After upgrade the Confluence started showing following error,

{panel}
Database is being updated by an instance which is not part of the current cluster. You should check network connections between cluster nodes, especially multicast traffic.
{panel}

Environment in which Confluence was installed is not clustered. This was fixed be restarting Confluence. This error appeared this morning again and here is what logs show,

2009-10-01 14:19:00,216 FATAL [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-0] [confluence.cluster.safety.ClusterPanicListener] handleEvent Fatal error in Confluence cluster: Database is being updated by an instance which is not part of the current cluster. You should check network connections between cluster nodes, especially multicast traffic.
2009-10-01 14:19:01,510 INFO [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-0] [confluence.cluster.safety.ClusterPanicListener] handleEvent com.atlassian.confluence.cluster.EmptyClusterInformation@124208b
2009-10-01 14:19:01,712 INFO [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-0] [confluence.cluster.safety.ClusterPanicListener] handleEvent Shutting down Quartz scheduler


This Confluence uses MySQL DB. Is there some fix for this problem?

Best Regards,
Tomi Mäkinen
fields.summary: After upgrading to Confluece 3.0.1. cluster error appears

fields.description:
It works well in Confluence 2.10.3.

When [importing a snipsnap data|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF29/Snip+Snap+Import], Confluence complains the Space ID has already exist in the database:
{noformat}
Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.NonUniqueObjectException: a different object with the same identifier value was already associated with the session: 2359302, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space
{noformat}

Of course the space id has already exist in the database because space id 2359302 is the destination space where we want to save the Snip Snap data.

The work around is to import your snipsnap data to Confluence 2.10.3 then upgrade the instance to Confluence 3.0.x.
fields.summary: Non-Unique Space error when importing SnipSnap data

fields.summary: Cannot attach images to a blog post that I am writing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17090].
  {panel}

On the "Restore Confluence Data" form you can tick "Build index" to rebuild the Confluence indexes after the restore. This makes sense for site-wide restores but not for space imports - the space will be indexed when the queue is next flushed.

CAC was recently brought down by an admin:
# Importing a space
# Realizing the space name was wrong
# Deleting the space and fixing the name
# Importing the space

\\
This fires two reindexes if "Build Index" is ticked each time. We should:
# Not reindex by default if the backup includes a single space
# Improve the UI to differentiate between site-wide and space-only imports
fields.summary: Restoring multiple backups allows multiple concurrent reindexes

fields.description:
Reindexing is an expensive task so we might want to keep the ability to reindex nodes one by one rather than doing it in parallel. However we should clearly indicate in UI that only 'current' node will be indexed if we stay with the current implementation.

Possibly, we can provide both options (all nodes/current node).
fields.summary: Reindexing in cluster only runs on one node if triggered from web UI

fields.description:
This seems to be caused by: 

{code}span { background-image: none } {code}

That we are using to address anti-aliasing. The following images don't show at all: 

!Picture 7.png! 

- attachment icon just underneath the title is invisible
- icons next to "Edit", "Add" and "Tools" menu don't appear 
- icons preceeding menu items (like Favourite, Attachments, Watch)

Works fine in IE7 or IE8 compatibility mode.
fields.summary: Background images/icons for menu elements and don't display in IE8

fields.description:
Hello all,

After an update Weblogic logs contain the following exception when reaching pages linked form another corporate server:
{noformat}
2009-09-24 09:14:56,859 ERROR [[ACTIVE] ExecuteThread: '0' for queue: 'weblogic.kernel.Default (self-tuning)'] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /login.action | userName: SCE
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot resize buffer - 311 bytes have already been written (Servlet 2.3, sec. 5.1)
{noformat}

There is no SSO or custom authenticator configured and GZIP compression is disabled. Possible hint on cause could be:
[Java Servlet - Re: java.lang.IllegalStateException: cannot resize buffer|http://forums.sun.com/thread.jspa?messageID=4409126#4409126]; maybe how the authorization dispatching vs. filter processing works on Weblogic?

Other than error logging there is no visible adverse effect or service disruption.

Best Regards,
Edoardo
fields.summary: "java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot resize buffer - ... (Servlet 2.3, sec. 5.1)" thrown when landing on Confluence pages from direct links

fields.description:
When a user attaches a Word 2007 document that contains shapes and/or text boxes, the viewfile macro doesn't display this portion of the document correctly.   The attached example has two examples:   
 * On the first page, there's a diagram with four ovals.  Each oval has text inside of it and each oval is connected to the next via a line with an arrow.   This diagram displays correctly in Word 2007 but the viewfile macro doesn't display it correctly.

* On page 3 of the document (in the section titled "Modifying a Record"), there's a table containing a series of steps.  In the second row, second column of the table, there's an image.  Layered on top of of the image, there's a red oval intended to highlight a portion of the image.  Again, this displays correctly in MS Word 2007 but not in the viewfile macro.
fields.summary: viewfile macros doesn't display shapes correctly in msword documents
